overview_of_class: This course will be concerned with multivariable integrals, which are the generalizations of the type of integral you saw in a single-variable calculus course to higher-dimensional settings. Specific topics include: double and triple integrals, change of variables, line and surface integrals, vector fields, and the fundamental theorems of Green, Stokes, and Gauss. We will focus on both setting-up and computing such integrals, and on understanding the types of situations in which they arise.
name: Multiple Integration and Vector Calculus
title: SCS MATH 234-CN-62 Multiple Integration and Vector Calculus

descriptions.value: This course will be concerned with multivariable integrals, which are the generalizations of the type of integral you saw in a single-variable calculus course to higher-dimensional settings. Specific topics include: double and triple integrals, change of variables, line and surface integrals, vector fields, and the fundamental theorems of Green, Stokes, and Gauss. We will focus on both setting-up and computing such integrals, and on understanding the types of situations in which they arise.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: MATH 230 or an equivalent course covering multivariable differentiation

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will come to understand how to setup and evaluate multivariable integrals (including double and triple integrals, line integrals, and surface integrals), and will understand the concrete ways in which such integrals arise in applications.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Essential Calculus: Early Transcendentals by James Stewart, ISBN 9781285142906.
